001package squidpony.squidgrid;
002
003import java.awt.Point;
004import java.util.ArrayList;
005import java.util.Collections;
006import java.util.Comparator;
007import java.util.Deque;
008import java.util.LinkedList;
009import java.util.List;
010
011/**
012 * This class provides methods for calculating Field of View in grids. Field of
013 * View (FOV) algorithms determine how much area surrounding a point can be
014 * seen. They return a two dimensional array of doubles, representing the amount
015 * of view (typically sight, but perhaps sound, smell, etc.) which the origin
016 * has of each cell.
017 *
018 * After a calculation has been run, the resulting light map is saved in the
019 * class. This allows the values to be checked on individual cells without being
020 * required to work with the returned light map. If no calculation has been
021 * performed, all value checking methods will return their version of "unlit".
022 *
023 * The input resistanceMap is considered the percent of opacity. This resistance
024 * is on top of the resistance applied from the light spreading out.
025 *
026 * The returned light map is considered the percent of light in the cells.
027 *
028 * Not all implementations are required to provide percentage levels of light.
029 * In such cases the returned values will be 0 for no light and 1.0 for fully
030 * lit. Implementations that return this way note so in their documentation.
031 *
032 * All solvers perform bounds checking so solid borders in the map are not
033 * required.
034 *
035 * @author Eben Howard - http://squidpony.com - howard@squidpony.com
036 */
037public class FOV {
038
039    public static final int//
040            /**
041             * Performs FOV by pushing values outwards from the source location.
042             * It will go around corners a bit.
043             */
044            RIPPLE = 1,
045            /**
046             * Performs FOV by pushing values outwards from the source location.
047             * It will spread around edges like smoke or water, but maintain a
048             * tendency to curl towards the start position when going around
049             * edges.
050             */
051            RIPPLE_LOOSE = 2,
052            /**
053             * Performs FOV by pushing values outwards from the source location.
054             * It will only go around corners slightly.
055             */
056            RIPPLE_TIGHT = 3,
057            /**
058             * Performs FOV by pushing values outwards from the source location.
059             * It will go around corners massively.
060             */
061            RIPPLE_VERY_LOOSE = 4,
062            /**
063             * Uses Shadow Casting FOV algorithm. Treats all translucent cells
064             * as fully transparent. Returns only that the cell is fully lit or
065             * not lit, does not do percentages.
066             */
067            SHADOW = 5;
068
069    private double lightMap[][], map[][];
070    private boolean indirect[][];//marks indirect lighting for Ripple FOV
071    private int type = SHADOW;
072    private int rippleNeighbors;
073    private double radius, decay, angle, span;
074    private int startx, starty, width, height;
075    private Radius radiusStrategy;
076    private Comparator<Point> comp;
077    private static Direction[] ccw = new Direction[]
078            {Direction.UP_RIGHT, Direction.UP_LEFT, Direction.DOWN_LEFT, Direction.DOWN_RIGHT, Direction.UP_RIGHT},
079            ccw_full = new Direction[]{Direction.RIGHT, Direction.UP_RIGHT, Direction.UP, Direction.UP_LEFT,
080            Direction.LEFT, Direction.DOWN_LEFT, Direction.DOWN, Direction.DOWN_RIGHT};
081
082    /**
083     * Creates a solver which will use the default SHADOW solver.
084     */
085    public FOV() {
086        lightMap = null;
087        map = null;
088    }
089
090    /**
091     * Creates a solver which will use the provided FOV solver type.
092     *
093     * @param type
094     */
095    public FOV(int type) {
096        lightMap = null;
097        map = null;
098        this.type = type;
099    }
100
101    /**
102     * Checks to see if the location is considered even partially lit.
103     *
104     * @param x
105     * @param y
106     * @return
107     */
108    public boolean isLit(int x, int y) {
109        return lightLevel(x, y) > 0;
110    }
111
112    /**
113     * Returns the light value at the given location.
114     *
115     * @param x
116     * @param y
117     * @return
118     */
119    public double lightLevel(int x, int y) {
120        if (lightMap == null) {
121            return 0;
122        } else {
123            return lightMap[x][y];
124        }
125    }
126
127    /**
128     * Returns the initial resistance value at the given point. If no
129     * calculation has yet been run, it returns 0.
130     *
131     * @param x
132     * @param y
133     * @return
134     */
135    public double resistance(int x, int y) {
136        if (map == null) {
137            return 0;
138        } else {
139            return map[x][y];
140        }
141    }
142
143    /**
144     * Calculates the Field Of View for the provided map from the given x, y
145     * coordinates. Returns a light map where the values represent a percentage
146     * of fully lit.
147     *
148     * The starting point for the calculation is considered to be at the center
149     * of the origin cell. Radius determinations based on Euclidean
150     * calculations. The light will be treated as having infinite possible
151     * radius.
152     *
153     * @param resistanceMap the grid of cells to calculate on
154     * @param startx the horizontal component of the starting location
155     * @param starty the vertical component of the starting location
156     * @return the computed light grid
157     */
158    public double[][] calculateFOV(double[][] resistanceMap, int startx, int starty) {
159        return calculateFOV(resistanceMap, startx, starty, Integer.MAX_VALUE);
160    }
161
162    /**
163     * Calculates the Field Of View for the provided map from the given x, y
164     * coordinates. Returns a light map where the values represent a percentage
165     * of fully lit.
166     *
167     * The starting point for the calculation is considered to be at the center
168     * of the origin cell. Radius determinations based on Euclidian
169     * calculations.
170     *
171     * @param resistanceMap the grid of cells to calculate on
172     * @param startx the horizontal component of the starting location
173     * @param starty the vertical component of the starting location
174     * @param radius the distance the light will extend to
175     * @return the computed light grid
176     */
177    public double[][] calculateFOV(double[][] resistanceMap, int startx, int starty, double radius) {
178        return calculateFOV(resistanceMap, startx, starty, radius, Radius.CIRCLE);
179    }
180
181    /**
182     * Calculates the Field Of View for the provided map from the given x, y
183     * coordinates. Returns a light map where the values represent a percentage
184     * of fully lit.
185     *
186     * The starting point for the calculation is considered to be at the center
187     * of the origin cell. Radius determinations are determined by the provided
188     * RadiusStrategy.
189     *
190     * @param resistanceMap the grid of cells to calculate on
191     * @param startX the horizontal component of the starting location
192     * @param startY the vertical component of the starting location
193     * @param radius the distance the light will extend to
194     * @param radiusTechnique provides a means to calculate the radius as desired
195     * @return the computed light grid
196     */
197    public double[][] calculateFOV(double[][] resistanceMap, int startX, int startY, double radius, Radius radiusTechnique) {
198        this.map = resistanceMap;
199        this.startx = startX;
200        this.starty = startY;
201        this.radius = Math.max(1, radius);
202        this.radiusStrategy = radiusTechnique;
203        this.comp = new Comparator<Point>() {
204            @Override
205            public int compare(Point pt1, Point pt2) {
206                return (int)Math.signum(radiusStrategy.radius(startx, starty, pt1.x, pt1.y) -
207                        radiusStrategy.radius(startx, starty, pt2.x, pt2.y));
208            }
209        };
210        decay = 1.0 / radius;
211
212        width = resistanceMap.length;
213        height = resistanceMap[0].length;
214
215        lightMap = new double[width][height];
216        lightMap[startx][starty] = 1;//make the starting space full power
217
218        switch (type) {
219            case RIPPLE:
220                indirect = new boolean[width][height];
221                rippleNeighbors = 2;
222                doRippleFOV(startx, starty);
223                break;
224            case RIPPLE_LOOSE:
225                indirect = new boolean[width][height];
226                rippleNeighbors = 3;
227                doRippleFOV(startx, starty);
228                break;
229            case RIPPLE_TIGHT:
230                indirect = new boolean[width][height];
231                rippleNeighbors = 1;
232                doRippleFOV(startx, starty);
233                break;
234            case RIPPLE_VERY_LOOSE:
235                indirect = new boolean[width][height];
236                rippleNeighbors = 6;
237                doRippleFOV(startx, starty);
238                break;
239            case SHADOW:
240                // hotfix for infinite radius -> set to longest possible straight-line Manhattan distance instead
241                // does not cause problems with brightness falloff because shadowcasting is on/off
242                // TODO do proper fix for shadowCast
243                if (radius >= Integer.MAX_VALUE){
244                        this.radius = width + height;
245                }
246                for (Direction d : Direction.DIAGONALS) {
247                    shadowCast(1, 1.0, 0.0, 0, d.deltaX, d.deltaY, 0);
248                    shadowCast(1, 1.0, 0.0, d.deltaX, 0, 0, d.deltaY);
249                }
250                break;
251        }
252
253        return lightMap;
254    }
255
256
257    /**
258     * Calculates the Field Of View for the provided map from the given x, y
259     * coordinates. Returns a light map where the values represent a percentage
260     * of fully lit.
261     *
262     * The starting point for the calculation is considered to be at the center
263     * of the origin cell. Radius determinations are determined by the provided
264     * RadiusStrategy. A conical section of FOV is lit by this method if
265     * startAngle and endAngle are not equal.
266     *
267     * @param resistanceMap the grid of cells to calculate on
268     * @param startX the horizontal component of the starting location
269     * @param startY the vertical component of the starting location
270     * @param radius the distance the light will extend to
271     * @param radiusTechnique provides a means to calculate the radius as desired
272     * @param angle the angle in degrees that will be the center of the FOV cone, 0 points right
273     * @param span the angle in degrees that measures the full arc contained in the FOV cone
274     * @return the computed light grid
275     */
276    public double[][] calculateFOV(double[][] resistanceMap, int startX, int startY, double radius,
277                                   Radius radiusTechnique, double angle, double span) {
278        this.map = resistanceMap;
279        this.startx = startX;
280        this.starty = startY;
281        this.radius = Math.max(1, radius);
282
283        this.angle = Math.toRadians((angle > 360.0 || angle < 0.0) ? Math.IEEEremainder(angle + 720.0, 360.0) : angle);
284        this.span = Math.toRadians(span);
285        this.radiusStrategy = radiusTechnique;
286        decay = 1.0 / radius;
287        this.comp = new Comparator<Point>() {
288            @Override
289            public int compare(Point pt1, Point pt2) {
290                return (int)Math.signum(radiusStrategy.radius(startx, starty, pt1.x, pt1.y) -
291                        radiusStrategy.radius(startx, starty, pt2.x, pt2.y));
292            }
293        };
294        width = resistanceMap.length;
295        height = resistanceMap[0].length;
296
297        lightMap = new double[width][height];
298        lightMap[startx][starty] = 1;//make the starting space full power
299
300        switch (type) {
301            case RIPPLE:
302                indirect = new boolean[width][height];
303                rippleNeighbors = 2;
304                doRippleFOVLimited(startx, starty);
305                break;
306            case RIPPLE_LOOSE:
307                indirect = new boolean[width][height];
308                rippleNeighbors = 3;
309                doRippleFOVLimited(startx, starty);
310                break;
311            case RIPPLE_TIGHT:
312                indirect = new boolean[width][height];
313                rippleNeighbors = 1;
314                doRippleFOVLimited(startx, starty);
315                break;
316            case RIPPLE_VERY_LOOSE:
317                indirect = new boolean[width][height];
318                rippleNeighbors = 6;
319                doRippleFOVLimited(startx, starty);
320                break;
321            case SHADOW:
322                int ctr = 0;
323                boolean started = false;
324                for (Direction d : ccw) {
325                    ctr %= 4;
326                    ++ctr;
327                    if (angle <= Math.PI / 2.0 * ctr + span / 2.0)
328                        started = true;
329                    if (started) {
330                        if(ctr < 4 && angle < Math.PI / 2.0 * (ctr - 1) - span / 2.0)
331                            break;
332                        shadowCastLimited(1, 1.0, 0.0, 0, d.deltaX, d.deltaY, 0);
333                        shadowCastLimited(1, 1.0, 0.0, d.deltaX, 0, 0, d.deltaY);
334                    }
335                }
336                break;
337        }
338
339        return lightMap;
340    }
341
342
343    private void doRippleFOV(int x, int y) {
344        Deque<Point> dq = new LinkedList<>();
345        dq.offer(new Point(x, y));
346        while (!dq.isEmpty()) {
347            Point p = dq.pop();
348            if (lightMap[p.x][p.y] <= 0 || indirect[p.x][p.y]) {
349                continue;//no light to spread
350            }
351
352            for (Direction dir : Direction.OUTWARDS) {
353                int x2 = p.x + dir.deltaX;
354                int y2 = p.y + dir.deltaY;
355                if (x2 < 0 || x2 >= width || y2 < 0 || y2 >= height //out of bounds
356                        || radiusStrategy.radius(startx, starty, x2, y2) >= radius + 1) {//+1 to cover starting tile
357                    continue;
358                }
359
360                double surroundingLight = nearRippleLight(x2, y2);
361                if (lightMap[x2][y2] < surroundingLight) {
362                    lightMap[x2][y2] = surroundingLight;
363                    if (map[x2][y2] < 1) {//make sure it's not a wall
364                        dq.offer(new Point(x2, y2));//redo neighbors since this one's light changed
365                    }
366                }
367            }
368        }
369    }
370
371
372    private void doRippleFOVLimited(int x, int y) {
373        Deque<Point> dq = new LinkedList<>();
374        dq.offer(new Point(x, y));
375        while (!dq.isEmpty()) {
376            Point p = dq.pop();
377            if (lightMap[p.x][p.y] <= 0 || indirect[p.x][p.y]) {
378                continue;//no light to spread
379            }
380
381            for (Direction dir : ccw_full) {
382                int x2 = p.x + dir.deltaX;
383                int y2 = p.y + dir.deltaY;
384                if (x2 < 0 || x2 >= width || y2 < 0 || y2 >= height //out of bounds
385                        || radiusStrategy.radius(startx, starty, x2, y2) >= radius + 1) {  //+1 to cover starting tile
386                    continue;
387                }
388                double newAngle = Math.atan2(y2 - starty, x2 - startx) + Math.PI * 2;
389                if(Math.abs(Math.IEEEremainder(angle - newAngle, Math.PI * 2)) > span / 2.0) continue;
390
391                double surroundingLight = nearRippleLight(x2, y2);
392                if (lightMap[x2][y2] < surroundingLight) {
393                    lightMap[x2][y2] = surroundingLight;
394                    if (map[x2][y2] < 1) {//make sure it's not a wall
395                        dq.offer(new Point(x2, y2));//redo neighbors since this one's light changed
396                    }
397                }
398            }
399        }
400    }
401
402    private double nearRippleLight(int x, int y) {
403        if (x == startx && y == starty) {
404            return 1;
405        }
406
407        List<Point> neighbors = new ArrayList<>();
408        for (Direction di : Direction.OUTWARDS) {
409            int x2 = x + di.deltaX;
410            int y2 = y + di.deltaY;
411            if (x2 >= 0 && x2 < width && y2 >= 0 && y2 < height) {
412                neighbors.add(new Point(x2, y2));
413            }
414        }
415
416        if (neighbors.isEmpty()) {
417            return 0;
418        }
419        Collections.sort(neighbors, comp);
420        neighbors = neighbors.subList(0, rippleNeighbors);
421/*
422        while (neighbors.size() > rippleNeighbors) {
423            Point p = neighbors.remove(0);
424            double dist = radiusStrategy.radius(startx, starty, p.x, p.y);
425            double dist2 = 0;
426            for (Point p2 : neighbors) {
427                dist2 = Math.max(dist2, radiusStrategy.radius(startx, starty, p2.x, p2.y));
428            }
429            if (dist < dist2) {//not the largest, put it back
430                neighbors.add(p);
431            }
432        }
433*/
434        double light = 0;
435        int lit = 0, indirects = 0;
436        for (Point p : neighbors) {
437            if (lightMap[p.x][p.y] > 0) {
438                lit++;
439                if (indirect[p.x][p.y]) {
440                    indirects++;
441                }
442                double dist = radiusStrategy.radius(x, y, p.x, p.y);
443                light = Math.max(light, lightMap[p.x][p.y] - dist * decay - map[p.x][p.y]);
444            }
445        }
446
447        if (map[x][y] >= 1 || indirects >= lit) {
448            indirect[x][y] = true;
449        }
450        return light;
451    }
452
453    private void shadowCast(int row, double start, double end, int xx, int xy, int yx, int yy) {
454        double newStart = 0;
455        if (start < end) {
456            return;
457        }
458
459        boolean blocked = false;
460        for (int distance = row; distance <= radius && !blocked; distance++) {
461            int deltaY = -distance;
462            for (int deltaX = -distance; deltaX <= 0; deltaX++) {
463                int currentX = startx + deltaX * xx + deltaY * xy;
464                int currentY = starty + deltaX * yx + deltaY * yy;
465                double leftSlope = (deltaX - 0.5f) / (deltaY + 0.5f);
466                double rightSlope = (deltaX + 0.5f) / (deltaY - 0.5f);
467
468                if (!(currentX >= 0 && currentY >= 0 && currentX < this.width && currentY < this.height) || start < rightSlope) {
469                    continue;
470                } else if (end > leftSlope) {
471                    break;
472                }
473
474
475                //check if it's within the lightable area and light if needed
476                if (radiusStrategy.radius(deltaX, deltaY) <= radius) {
477                    double bright = 1 - decay * radiusStrategy.radius(deltaX, deltaY);
478                    lightMap[currentX][currentY] = bright;
479                }
480
481                if (blocked) { //previous cell was a blocking one
482                    if (map[currentX][currentY] >= 1) {//hit a wall
483                        newStart = rightSlope;
484                    } else {
485                        blocked = false;
486                        start = newStart;
487                    }
488                } else {
489                    if (map[currentX][currentY] >= 1 && distance < radius) {//hit a wall within sight line
490                        blocked = true;
491                        shadowCast(distance + 1, start, leftSlope, xx, xy, yx, yy);
492                        newStart = rightSlope;
493                    }
494                }
495            }
496        }
497    }
498    private void shadowCastLimited(int row, double start, double end, int xx, int xy, int yx, int yy) {
499        double newStart = 0;
500        if (start < end) {
501            return;
502        }
503
504        boolean blocked = false;
505        for (int distance = row; distance <= radius && !blocked; distance++) {
506            int deltaY = -distance;
507            for (int deltaX = -distance; deltaX <= 0; deltaX++) {
508                int currentX = startx + deltaX * xx + deltaY * xy;
509                int currentY = starty + deltaX * yx + deltaY * yy;
510                double leftSlope = (deltaX - 0.5f) / (deltaY + 0.5f);
511                double rightSlope = (deltaX + 0.5f) / (deltaY - 0.5f);
512
513                if (!(currentX >= 0 && currentY >= 0 && currentX < this.width && currentY < this.height) || start < rightSlope) {
514                    continue;
515                } else if (end > leftSlope) {
516                    break;
517                }
518                double newAngle = Math.atan2(currentY - starty, currentX - startx) + Math.PI * 2;
519                if(Math.abs(Math.IEEEremainder(angle - newAngle, Math.PI * 2)) > span / 2.0) continue;
520
521                //check if it's within the lightable area and light if needed
522                if (radiusStrategy.radius(deltaX, deltaY) <= radius) {
523                    double bright = 1 - decay * radiusStrategy.radius(deltaX, deltaY);
524                    lightMap[currentX][currentY] = bright;
525                }
526
527                if (blocked) { //previous cell was a blocking one
528                    if (map[currentX][currentY] >= 1) {//hit a wall
529                        newStart = rightSlope;
530                    } else {
531                        blocked = false;
532                        start = newStart;
533                    }
534                } else {
535                    if (map[currentX][currentY] >= 1 && distance < radius) {//hit a wall within sight line
536                        blocked = true;
537                        shadowCastLimited(distance + 1, start, leftSlope, xx, xy, yx, yy);
538                        newStart = rightSlope;
539                    }
540                }
541            }
542        }
543    }
544}
